core.generalErrorMessage: Something went wrong, please check the configuration
core.title: Core Settings
deleteNode.prompt: Are you sure you want to delete the {{name}} node?
deleteNode.title: Delete Node
deleteUser.prompt: Are you sure you want to delete {{username}}?
deleteUser.title: Delete User
hostsDialog.dataLimit: The usage limit of the user
hostsDialog.dataUsage: The current usage of the user
hostsDialog.desc: Use these variables to make it dynamic
hostsDialog.subscriptionTypesHelp: Leave empty to show this host in all subscription types.
hostsDialog.fragment.info.attention: Attention: currently, this feature only supported in streisand >= 1.6.12 and v2rayNG >= 1.8.16 (custom config)
hostsDialog.noise.info.attention: Attention: currently, this feature only supported in streisand >= 1.6.32 and v2rayNG >= 1.8.39 (custom config)
hostsDialog.host.info: By default, if a request host is set in the Xray config, this host is used. However, you can set a custom request host here if needed.
hostsDialog.host.multiHost: To set multiple addresses, separate them with <badge>,</badge> Each time an address is chosen randomly.
hostsDialog.host.wildcard: Use <badge>*</badge> to generate a random string (works for wildcard domain names)
hostsDialog.jalaliExpireDate: Expiry date of the user in solar calendar
hostsDialog.path.info: Set a path for host users, useful behind a reverse proxy.
hostsDialog.port.info: By default, a host uses the default port of the inbound. You can set a custom port in case this host is a server that forwards traffic from a port that differs from your server's port. For example, the server may forward traffic from port 8443 to the default port of your inbound server.
hostsDialog.proxyOutbound.info: Extra outbound ( only in v2ray custom config )
hostsDialog.security.info: If the middleware server of this host uses a different security layer than the inbound's default, you can set a custom security layer here.
hostsDialog.sni.info: By default, a host uses the default SNI of the inbound. You can set a custom SNI in case this host is a server that has a different SNI. For example, the server may receive traffic with a different SSL certificate, perform SSL termination, and forward it to your inbound server.
hostsDialog.title: Using this setting, you are able to assign specific address for each inbound.
login.welcomeBack: Welcome back, please enter your details
nodes.addHostForEveryInbound: Add this node as a new host for every inbound
nodes.connection-hint: To setup a Marzban Node, you need to set this certificate on the node to initialize a secure connection between main server and the node
nodes.title: Using Marzban-Node, you are able to scale up your connection quality by adding different nodes on different servers.
resetAllUsage.error: Usage reset failed, please try again.
resetAllUsage.prompt: This action clears all of the users' data usage completely. Are you sure you want to reset all usage? THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE!
resetAllUsage.title: Reset data usage for all users
resetUserUsage.error: Usage reset failed, please try again.
resetUserUsage.prompt: Are you sure you want to reset {{username}}'s usage?
resetUserUsage.title: Reset User Usage
revokeUserSub.error: Subscription revoke failed, please try again.
revokeUserSub.prompt: Are you sure you want to revoke {{username}}'s subscription?
revokeUserSub.title: Revoke User Subscription
userDialog.hwidDeviceLimitModeHelp: Global setting can be Enabled, Disabled, or Logging.
userDialog.hwidDeviceLimitHelp: Max devices allowed. Leave empty to use the fallback limit.
userDialog.selectOneProtocol: Please select at least one protocol
userDialog.shadowsocksDesc: Fast and secure, but not efficient as others
userDialog.warningNoProtocol: Please select at least one protocol
usersTable.noUser: There is no user added to the system
usersTable.noUserMatched: It seems there is no user matched with what you are looking for
settings.title: Settings
settings.description: Manage runtime configuration values stored in .env. Changes may require a backend restart to take effect.
settings.groups.templatesDescription: Template paths and custom page files used for subscriptions and landing pages.
settings.groups.clientJsonDescription: Toggle JSON configs per client application.
settings.subscriptionPageTemplateHelp: Template used for the subscription info page (default: subscription/index.html).
settings.clashSubscriptionTemplateHelp: Template used to generate Clash configs (default: clash/default.yml).
settings.v2rayMetaConfigHelp: V2ray meta config template file (used for the Happ app and JSON subscriptions).
settings.externalConfigHelp: External config path or URL applied to subscriptions.
settings.xraySubscriptionPathHelp: Custom path segment for subscription URLs.
settings.useCustomJsonDefaultHelp: Enable JSON configs for all supported clients by default (default: false).
settings.useCustomJsonForV2raynHelp: Enable JSON configs for v2rayN only (default: false).
settings.useCustomJsonForV2rayngHelp: Enable JSON configs for v2rayNG only (default: false).
settings.useCustomJsonForStreisandHelp: Enable JSON configs for Streisand only (default: false).
settings.useCustomJsonForHappHelp: Enable JSON configs for Happ only (default: false).
settings.useCustomJsonForNpvtunnel: Use JSON config for NPV Tunnel
settings.useCustomJsonForNpvtunnelHelp: Enable JSON configs for NPV Tunnel only (default: false).
settings.envOnlyDescription: These options are not editable here and must be updated directly in .env.
settings.notifyStatusChangeHelp: Send a notification when a user's status changes.
settings.notifyUserCreatedHelp: Send a notification when a new user is created.
settings.notifyUserUpdatedHelp: Send a notification when a user is updated.
settings.notifyUserDeletedHelp: Send a notification when a user is deleted.
settings.notifyUserDataUsedReset: Notify when data usage is reset
settings.notifyUserDataUsedResetHelp: Send a notification when data usage is reset.
settings.notifyUserSubRevokedHelp: Send a notification when a subscription is revoked.
settings.notifyUsagePercentReached: Notify when usage percentage is reached
settings.notifyUsagePercentReachedHelp: Enable notifications when usage percentage hits configured thresholds.
settings.notifyDaysLeftReached: Notify when days left is reached
settings.notifyDaysLeftReachedHelp: Enable notifications when remaining days hit configured thresholds.
settings.notifyLoginHelp: Send a notification when an admin logs in.
settings.notifyReachedUsagePercentHelp: Usage percentage thresholds that trigger notifications (default: 80).
settings.recurrentNotificationsTimeoutHe: Delay between repeated notifications for the same event (default: 180s).
settings.numberOfRecurrentNotificationsH: Maximum number of repeated notifications per event (default: 3).
settings.usersAutodeleteDaysHelp: Delete expired users after this many days; negative disables (default: -1).
settings.userAutodeleteIncludeLimitedAcc: Include limited accounts in auto-delete (default: false).
settings.subSupportUrlHelp: Support URL displayed in subscription clients.
settings.subProfileTitleHelp: Profile title shown in subscription clients. Supports {USERNAME} and {STATUS_TEXT}.
settings.subscriptionCustomHeadersHelp: Send extra response headers when the User-Agent matches (use * to match all, partial matches are allowed).
settings.subscriptionCustomHeadersEmpty: No custom headers yet. Add one below.
settings.subscriptionHideDefaultHosts: Hide default hosts when custom hosts are set
settings.subscriptionHideDefaultHostsHel: Hide default hosts when custom hosts exist (default: false).
settings.subscriptionCustomNotesExpired: Custom notes for expired users (use | to separate)
settings.subscriptionCustomNotesExpiredH: Notes shown to expired users in subscriptions.
settings.subscriptionCustomNotesLimited: Custom notes for limited users (use | to separate)
settings.subscriptionCustomNotesLimitedH: Notes shown to limited users in subscriptions.
settings.subscriptionCustomNotesDisabled: Custom notes for disabled users (use | to separate)
Notes shown to disabled users in subscriptions.
settings.subscriptionCustomNotesHwidLimi: Custom notes for HWID limit rejections (use | to separate)
Notes shown when HWID limits block subscription access.
settings.hwidDeviceLimitEnabledHelp: Choose how HWID device limits are enforced (default: disabled).
settings.hwidFallbackDeviceLimitHelp: Device limit used when no per-user limit is set (default: 1).
settings.hwidDeviceRetentionDaysHelp: How long to keep HWID devices since their last device update.
settings.jobCoreHealthCheckIntervalHelp: How often to check core health.
settings.jobRecordNodeUsagesIntervalHelp: How often to record node usage.
settings.jobRecordUserUsagesIntervalHelp: How often to record user usage.
settings.jobRecordRealtimeBandwidthInter: How often to record realtime bandwidth.
settings.jobRecordUserUsagesWorkersHelp: Worker count for recording user usage.
settings.jobCoreHealthCheckMaxInstancesH: Max parallel core health check jobs.
settings.jobHwidDeviceCleanupIntervalHel: How often to cleanup old HWID devices.
settings.skipNodeDisconnectOnShutdown: Keep nodes connected on Marzban restart
settings.skipNodeDisconnectOnShutdownHel: When enabled, Marzban will not send disconnect commands to nodes during shutdown/restart.
settings.webhookAddressHelp: Comma-separated list of webhook endpoints used for notifications.
